ControlledConcept.gml:description: Chemical composition term used for igneous rocks, denoting that content of aluminum oxide is greater than sodium oxide plus potassium oxide, but aluminum oxide less than sum of Na, K and Ca oxide. Source: Shand 1947
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:metaluminous
ControlledConcept.name: Metaluminous

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Aluminum oxide (Al2O3) is less than sum of K and Na oxide. Source: Shand 1947
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:peralkaline
ControlledConcept.name: Peralkaline

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Aluminum oxide (Al2O3) greater than sum of Na, K and Ca oxide. Source: Shand 1947
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:peraluminous
ControlledConcept.name: Peraluminous

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Aluminum oxide within 10 percent of sum of Na and K oxide. Source: Shand 1947
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:subaluminous
ControlledConcept.name: Subaluminous

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Containing greater than 5 percent reduced carbon in compounds that are typically the diagenetic products of dead organisms (e.g. coal, bitumen and petroleum). 5 percent value is chosen for consistency with SLTTs usage of term carbonaceous. Source: Struik2002; SLTTs2004; This vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:carbonaceous_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: Carbonaceous chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: The carbonate (CO3) anion is the predominant anion (by mole percent) in chemical analysis. Sub-categories may be defined by dominant cation. Material in this chemical class overlaps with the monomineralic carbonate class, and probably overlaps with the Carbonate class in the mineralogical composition classification. Source: Struik etal 2002; this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:carbonate_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: Carbonate chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: CO3 is the predominant anion, and greater than 5 mole percent of cations are Ba. Source: SMR definition
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:barium_bearing_carbonate_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: Barium-bearing carbonate chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: CO3 is the predominante anion, and the Ca is the most abundant (mole percent) cation. Source: Struik etal 2002; this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:calcium_rich_carbonate_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: Calcium-rich carbonate chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: CO3 is the predominant anion, and iron is greater than 5 mole percent of the cations (includes Fe, Mg, Mn, Ba, Sr, Ca...). Source: SMR definition
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:iron_bearing_carbonate_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: Iron-bearing carbonate chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: CO3 is the predominant anion, and iron is the most abundant (mole percent) cation Source: SMR definition
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:iron_rich_carbonate_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: Iron-rich carbonate chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: CO3 is the predominant anion, and Mg is the most abundant (mole percent) cation. Source: Struik etal 2002; this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:magnesium_rich_carbonate_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: Magnesium-rich carbonate chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: One or more of halide group elements (F, Cl, Br, I) are most abundant (mole percent) anion Source: Struik etal 2002; this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:halide_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: Halide chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Chloride is the most abundant (mole percent) anion Source: Struik etal 2002; this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:chloride_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: Chloride chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Fluorine is the most abundant (mole percent) anion Source: Struik etal 2002; this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:fluoride_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: Fluoride chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Nitrate (NO3) is most abundant (mole percent) anion. Source: Struik etal 2002; this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:nitrate_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: Nitrate chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Phosphate (PO4) is the most abundant (mole percent) anion. Source: Struik etal 2002; this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:phosphate_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: Phosphate chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sulfur is the most abundant anion; cations are metals or semimetals. Source: Neuendorf et al 2005; Struik 2002; this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:sulfide_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: Sulfide chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sulfide in which a semimetal (As, Sb, Bi) is present in a cation role Source: Neuendorf et al 2005; Struik 2002; this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:sulfosalt_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: Sulfosalt chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Composed of minerals whose crystal structure contains SiO4 tetrahedra, either isolated or joined through one or more oxygen atoms to form groups, chains, sheets or three-dimensional structures with metallic cations. Composition ranges from 20-100 percent SiO2. Typically some Al substitutues for silica. A survey of chemical analyses in the Georock database (query FOR ALL GEOLOGICAL SETTINGS, MATERIAL: WHOLE ROCK (AND VOLCANIC GLASS), PUB. YEARS: 2005-1970), 10/10/2005 state, http://georoc.mpch-mainz.gwdg.de/georoc/Entry.html) discovered that the lowest silica (Si02) content for igneous rock is about 20 percent. This is consistent with the lowest silica content found for a silicate mineral is about 21 percent for a chlorite variety found by scanning the mineral analyses in Deer, Howie, and Zussman (1966). Source: Neuendorf et al 2005; Struik 2002; this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:silicate_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: Silicate chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Containing 65 percent or more SiO2 by weight. Syn acid. Source: Struik2002; SLTTs2004; this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:high_silica_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: High silica chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Containing SiO2 in the range 52-65 percent, sometimes described as "intermediate" rocks. Source: Struik2002; SLTTs2004; this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:intermediate_silica_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: Intermediate silica chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Containing SiO2 in the range 44-52 percent. Syn basic. Source: Struik2002; SLTTs2004; this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:low_silica_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: Low silica chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Containing between about 20 and 44 percent SiO2. A survey of chemical analyses in the Georock database (query FOR ALL GEOLOGICAL SETTINGS, MATERIAL: WHOLE ROCK (AND VOLCANIC GLASS), PUB. YEARS: 2005-1970), 10/10/2005 state, http://georoc.mpch-mainz.gwdg. syn ultrabasic. Source: Struik2002; SLTTs2004; this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:very_low_silica_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: Very low silica chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sulfate is the most abundant anion Source: Struik etal 2002; this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:sulfate_chemistry
ControlledConcept.name: sulfate chemistry

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Crude oil or natural gas is present, generally in trace amounts, commonly detected by smell Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:petroliferous
ControlledConcept.name: petroliferous

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material containing significant carbon or hydrocarbon mineral phases, including graphite, coal, oil, gas, lignite, peat. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:carbonaceous
ControlledConcept.name: carbonaceous

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material contains a significant amount of asphalt, which is “A dark brown to black viscous liquid or low-melting solid bitumen that consists almost entirely of carbon and hydrogen...[and] formed in oil-bearing rocks by the evaporation of volatiles...” (Jackson, 1997, p. 39). Source: Jackson 1997
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:asphaltic
ControlledConcept.name: asphaltic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate minerals of any sort are present, but less than 50 percent of rock. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:carbonate_bearing
ControlledConcept.name: Carbonate bearing

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Calcium carbonate minerals are present, carbonate minerals form less than 50 percent of rock, material contains sufficient CaCO3 to react forming bubbles when hydrochloric acid is applied. Source: NADM SLTTm 2004
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:calcareous
ControlledConcept.name: Calcareous

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Dolomite is present, carbonate minerals form less than 50 percent of rock. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:dolomitic
ControlledConcept.name: dolomitic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Calcsilicate minerals of any sort are present, but less than 50 percent of rock Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:calcsilicate_bearing
ControlledConcept.name: calcsilicate-bearing

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material consists of greater than 50 percent calcsilicate or carbonate minerals and relative proportion of calcsilicate and carbonate minerals is unknown or not specified. Source: NADM SLTTm 2004
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:impure_calcsilicate_or_carbonate
ControlledConcept.name: Impure calcsilicate or carbonate

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material consists of greater than or equal to 50 percent calcsilicate or carbonate minerals and carbonate minerals less than or equal to calcsilicate minerals in mineral mode. Source: NADM SLTTm 2004
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:calcsilicate
ControlledConcept.name: Calcsilicate

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material consists of greater than 50 percent calcsilicate or carbonate minerals and carbonate minerals greater than calcsilicate minerals in mineral mode. Metacarbonate of NADMSC SLTTm (2004) terminology, adopted here for non-genetic use. Source: NADM SLTTm 2004
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:carbonate
ControlledConcept.name: Carbonate

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Rock in which carbonate minerals form greater than 75 percent of rock. Source: NADM SLTTm 2004
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:monomineralic_carbonate
ControlledConcept.name: Monomineralic carbonate

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate minerals form greater than 75 percent of rock, and calcium carbonate minerals forms greater than 75 percent of carbonate minerals. Source: NADM SLTTm 2004
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:calcareous_monomeralic_carbonate
ControlledConcept.name: Calcareous monomeralic carbonate

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate minerals form greater than 75 percent of rock, and dolomite forms greater than 75 percent of carbonate minerals. Source: NADM SLTTm 2004
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:dolomite_monomineralic_carbonate
ControlledConcept.name: Dolomite monomineralic carbonate

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material for which the sum of modal quartz+feldspar+ mica + aluminous mineral is greater than or equal to 70 percent. Source: NADM SLTTm 2004
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:quartz_feldspar_pelitic
ControlledConcept.name: Quartz-feldspar-pelitic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material for which the sum of modal quartz+feldspar+ mica + aluminous mineral is greater than or equal to 70 percent, and quartz + feldspar (sensu Robertson, 1999) greater than 60 percent. Source: NADM SLTTm 2004
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:quartzo_feldspathic
ControlledConcept.name: Quartzo-feldspathic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material consists of greater than or equal to 75 percent quartz. Source: NADM SLTTm 2004
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:quartzose
ControlledConcept.name: Quartzose

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material for which the sum of modal quartz+feldspar+ mica + aluminous mineral is greater than or equal to 70 percent, and quartz+ feldspar less than 60 percent Source: NADM SLTTm 2004
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:semi_pelitic
ControlledConcept.name: Semi-pelitic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material for which the sum of modal quartz+feldspar+ mica + aluminous mineral is greater than or equal to 70 percent, and aluminous mineral + mica content is greater than or equal to 40 percent. Source: NADM SLTTm 2004
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:pelitic
ControlledConcept.name: Pelitic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material consists of greater than 40 percent dark ferromagnesian silicate minerals. Standard term defined by Bates and Jackson (1987) to mean 'containing iron and magnesium'. Subsumes mafic and ultramafic. Source: NADM SLTTm 2004
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:ferromagnesian
ControlledConcept.name: Ferromagnesian

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material consists of greater than or equal to 40 percent and less than 90 percent ferromagnesian silicate minerals. Source: NADM SLTTm 2004
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:mafic
ControlledConcept.name: Mafic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material consists of greater than 90 percent ferromagnesian silicate minerals.. Source: NADM SLTTm 2004
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:ultramafic
ControlledConcept.name: Ultramafic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Greater than accessory amount (greater than 5 percent by volume) of clay is present Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:argillic
ControlledConcept.name: Argillic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Greater than accessory amount (greater than 5 percent by volume) of chlorite group minerals are present Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:chloritic
ControlledConcept.name: Chloritic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Greater than accessory amount (greater than 5 percent by volume) of non-silicate iron minerals (hematite, magnetite, siderite...) are present. Rocks containing abundant iron-rich silicate minerals would use the 'Ferromagnesian' terms. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:ferruginous
ControlledConcept.name: Ferruginous

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Greater than accessory amount (greater than 5 percent by volume) of mica group mineral are present Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:micaceous
ControlledConcept.name: Micaceous

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Greater than accessory amounts (greater than 5 percent by volume) of base metal oxide minerals such as magnetite (Fe3O4) or pyrolusite (MnO2) are present. Source: Struik2002; SLTTs2004; this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:metallic_oxide_bearing
ControlledConcept.name: Metallic oxide bearing

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Greater than 75 percent of the material consists of a single mineral species. Source: NADM SLTTm 2004
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:mono_mineralic
ControlledConcept.name: Mono mineralic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material predominantly composed of oxide minerals Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:oxide
ControlledConcept.name: Oxide

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Greater than accessory amount (greater than 5 percent by volume) of phosphate minerals are present Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:phosphatic
ControlledConcept.name: Phosphatic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Greater than accessory amount (greater than 5 percent by volume) of silica, amorphous, as quartz, or any of the silica polymorphs are present Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:silicic
ControlledConcept.name: Silicic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Greater than accessory amount (greater than 5 percent by volume) of sulfide mineral are present Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:sulfide_bearing
ControlledConcept.name: sulfide bearing

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material predominantly composed of sulfide minerals Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:sulfide
ControlledConcept.name: sulfide

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Material predominantly composed of sulfate minerals Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:sulfate
ControlledConcept.name: sulfate

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sedimentary material contains significant broken skeletal material Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:bioclastic
ControlledConcept.name: Bioclastic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Carbonate sedimentary material contains signficant intraclast content Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:intraclastic
ControlledConcept.name: Intraclastic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Grains or clasts are composed of a single rock or mineral type (Jackson, 1997) Source: Jackson 1997
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:monomictic
ControlledConcept.name: Monomictic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Grains or clasts are composed of many mineral or rock types Source: Jackson, 1997, p. 501
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:polymictic
ControlledConcept.name: Polymictic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary material contains significant feldspar mineral content Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:feldspathic
ControlledConcept.name: Feldspathic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary material contains significant detrital rock fragments derived by erosion from older, pre-existing rock materials Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:lithic
ControlledConcept.name: Lithic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: General sandstone petrography term for a sandstone in which the ratio of feldspar to lithic fragments is greater than 1:1 and less than 75 percent quartz is present in the detrital mode. Subsumes lithic arkosic and arkosic sandstone petrographic composition classes. Usage of modifier feldspathic is consistent with petrographic subdivisions of Dott (1964) and Williams, Turner and Gilbert (1982) Source: Dott1964; Folk1968
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:feldspathic_detrital_mode
ControlledConcept.name: Feldspathic detrital mode

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sandstone petrographic composition term indicating that detrital mode for clastic rock (Q-F-L) includes less than 75 percent quartz and the ratio of lithic fragments to feldspar is between 1:1 and 1:3. This corresponds to the lithic arkose field of Folk (1968); the 75 percent quartz boundary is chosen to be consistent with quartzsose composition as defined in the mineralogic compostion terms vocabulary. Because of the abundance of lithic fragments for which the mineralogic composition is not specified, and the presence of undiscernible matrix and cement that are not incuded in the detrital mode, corresondence with the mineralogical composition terms is very approximate. Source: Folk1968
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:lithic_arkosic_detrital_mode
ControlledConcept.name: Lithic arkosic detrital mode

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sandstone petrographic composition term indicating that detrital mode for clastic rock (Q-F-L) includes less than 75 percent quartz and the feldspar to lithic ratio is greater than 3 to 1. This corresponds to the arkose field of Folk (1968). For clastic rocks with little or no matrix and cement, rocks in this detrital mode composition category will also have quartz-feldspathic mineralogical composition. Source: Folk1968
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:arkosic_detrital_mode
ControlledConcept.name: Arkosic detrital mode

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sandstone petrographic composition term indicating that detrital mode for clastic rock (Q-F-L) includes less than 75 percent quartz and the lithic to feldspar ratio is greater than 3 to 1. This corresponds to the litharenite field of Folk (1968). Because the mineralogy of the lithic fragments is not constrained, the mineralogical composition is largely independent of the detrital mode composition for this class. Source: Folk1968
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:lithic_detrital_mode
ControlledConcept.name: Lithic detrital mode

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sandstone petrographic composition term indicating that the ratio of lithic fragments to feldspar is greater than 1:1, and less than 75 percent quartz is present in the detrital mode. Because the mineralogy of the lithic fragments is not constrained, the mineralogical composition is largely independent of the detrital mode composition for this class. Source: Dott1964; Folk1968
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:lithic_rich_detrital_mode
ControlledConcept.name: Lithic rich detrital mode

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sandstone petrographic composition term indicating that detrital mode for clastic rock (Q-F-L) includes less than 75 percent quartz and the feldspar to lithic ratio is between 1 to 1 and 1 to 3. This corresponds to the feldspathic litharenite field of Folk (1968). Rocks in this class are likely to be quartzo-feldspathic in terms of mineralogical composition terms in this vocablary, but because the mineralogical composition of the lithic fraction is not constrainged, this correlation is not necessary. Source: Folk1968
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:feldspathic_lithic_detrital_mode
ControlledConcept.name: Feldspathic lithic detrital mode

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sandstone petrographic composition term indicating that detrital mode for clastic rock (Q-F-L) includes less than 50 percent lithic fragments, between 75 and 95 percent quartz (thus less than 25 percent feldspar). This corresponds to the subarkose field of Folk (1968); the 75 percent quartz boundary is consistent with the quartzsose composition as defined in the mineralogic compostion terms vocabulary, but if more than a few percent 'matrix' or cement is present, this is not necessarily equivalent to the mineralogical composition term. Source: Folk1968
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:sub_feldspathic_detrital_mode
ControlledConcept.name: Sub feldspathic detrital mode

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sandstone petrographic composition term indicating that detrital mode for clastic rock (Q-F-L) includes more than 50 percent lithic fragments, between 75 and 95 percent quartz (thus less than 25 percent feldspar). This corresponds to the sublitharenite field of Folk (1968); the 75 percent quartz boundary is consistent with quartzsose composition as defined in the mineralogic compostion terms vocabulary. Source: Folk1968
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:sub_lithic_detrital_mode
ControlledConcept.name: Sub lithic detrital mode

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Detrital mineral grains in a granular rock consist of greater than 95 percent quartz. This petrographic criteria follows the most restrictive definition of the composition field at the quartz vertex of the sandstone QFL triangle (Folk, 1968). This use of term quartzose is more restrictive that that used in the mineralogical composition term vocabulary, reflecting the interpretive significance of pure quartz sandstones in sedimentary petrology. Source: Folk1968; this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:quartzose_detrital_mode
ControlledConcept.name: Quartzose detrital mode

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Sedimentary material contains significant broken volcanic rock fragments or vitric fragments, irrespective of their pyroclastic or epiclastic origin. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:volcanic_lithic
ControlledConcept.name: Volcanic lithic

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Composition is known but doesn’t' fit in any other category Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:other_composition
ControlledConcept.name: other composition

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Composition not specified. Use in normative descriptions where any composition property is allowed. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompositionCategory:200811:composition_not_specified
ControlledConcept.name: Composition not specified
